> Hmm.  I found something interesting in my hard drive:
>
> There's this compressed folder called "glad38kr".  Would by chance
> that happen to be the zip file for registered Gladiator, version 3.8k
> with W:ME misinterpreting what that really is?

Probably, I know that Win XP has a built-in zip file decompressor and that
explorer treats them like folders (and it's a real PITA because it takes soo
freaking long for the OS to deal with them compared to normal files/folders)
and Win ME might have it as well.
And all versions of windows by default hide file extensions for 'known' (and
in a lot of cases 'unknown') files, hence the missing .zip extension.

Try opening it, should ask for the password, and you should know the
password :)

- Deathifier
